textBox.richText: Today is the 30th anniversary of the Apple Macintosh computer - the computer, that from its conception, was designed to be “the computer for the rest of us.”   In other words, “the computer whose design was entirely focused on making our lives easier with technology.” And 30 years later, I would definitely say that Apple succeeded in doing just that.  Of any tech company, Apple has made the most difference to people’s lives, from the Macintosh to the PowerBook to the iMac to the iPod to the iPhone to the iPad to the AppleTV to the MacBook and more.  I’m a big user of Apple technology, and as someone who works in the tech industry, I have an intense appreciation for products that are well designed from both a user, hardware and software point of view.  And right now, Apple shines above anything else in that space. As a result, you’ll probably see plenty of other posts today about the 30th anniversary of the Macintosh - even iFixit did a teardown of the original Mac 128K: http://techcrunch.com/2014/01/24/ifixit-tears-down-the-macintosh-128k-to-celebrate-the-computers-30th-birthday/ At home, I actually have a very large vintage Apple and Macintosh computer collection (see my old computers page), and the picture at the top of this post is my daughter Mac next to my original Mac 128K computer from 1984.  Her name is only a coincidence......really ;-)
